intro: Antennaria tropicicola, commonly known as the tropical mouse-ear cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that helps it retain moisture in its arid habitat. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Antennaria tropicicola is adapted to rocky and coastal environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
